    • Constructor Detail

      • VectorOperations

        public VectorOperations()

    • Method Detail

      • mutation

        public static Vector mutation(Vector positiveV,
              Vector negativeV,
              Vector positiveV2)
        Mutation operation, used to create the noisyVector. The equation will be: postiveV2 + F * (positiveV - negativeV). Note that the fitness is not calculated in this operation.
        Parameters:
        positiveV - Randomly chosen vector 1.
        negativeV - Randomly chosen vector 2.
        positiveV2 - Randomly chosen vector 3.
        Returns:
        The noisy vector to be used for crossover.

      • crossover

        public static Vector crossover(Vector targetVector,
               Vector noisyVector,
               java.util.Random random)
        Crossover operation, used to create the trial vector. Note the fitness is not calculated in this operation
        Parameters:
        targetVector - The target vector, from the parent population.
        noisyVector - The noisy vector, generated from 3 randomly selected mutually exclusive parents.
        random - The random number object.
        Returns:
        The trial vector.

      • selection

        public static Vector selection(Vector target,
               Vector trial)
        Selection operation, determines based on the fitness values which will pass on to the next generation.
        Parameters:
        target - The target vector.
        trial - The trial vector.
        Returns:
        The most fit vector.
